newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan party official calls for stock measures - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: Japan party official calls for stock measures - Jiji.

text.p: The secretary-general of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party, Koichi Kato, on Monday called on Taku Yamazaki, chairman of the party's policy-making committee, to come up with measures to deal with weak stock prices, Jiji news agency reported on Monday.
Kato was quoted by Jiji as telling a news conference that he did not think the LDP could easily come up with measures to deal with weak stock prices.
"I asked him (Yamazaki) to see if there are any ways to tackle the weak stock market," Kato was quoted as saying.
Kato and Yamazaki exchanged views on stock prices, and they agreed that the recent plunges were not in line with the steadily recovering economy, Jiji said.
Kato asked Yamazaki to study medium- and long-term reasons for the recent fall in Tokyo stock prices.
